name: Jacqui Sweet
text: They are excellent as usual and willingly explain everything. It's refreshing to watch them work as a team and get it done. Worth the drive and we won't go anywhere else.

name: Yoshi Kasahara
text: Git 60K mile maintenance done and alignment. All are done in timely manner and techs are very helpful to questions you may have.

name: AMF F
text: We have been using Bay Diesel for years.  The owner, Chris, has always been very helpful.  The office staff is very efficient and Chris and his service crew have been very reliable and honest with their recommendations for the repairs that we have needed.

name: ronald clark
text: GREAT SERVICE AND VERY REASONABLE PRICES. BUT U  NEED TO BE PATIENT TO GET AN APPOINTMENT.

name: William Settles
text:
Coach in for annual service; everything done quickly and properly. Issues with the chassis jacks was addressed with new springs and oil in the reservoir. Had an overnight.leak on the jack system; 2 mechanics came to my location and checked the system. Leak attributed to slight.overfill.as no system leaks were found.
Good folks, great service!

name: Cynthia Hare
text: Love these people. They are so accommodating and knowledgeable.

name: Wayne Wantz
text: For the 2nd straight year the guys at Bay Diesel did an excellent job for a fair price. I was checked in on time and service was completed by knowledgeable technicians. Highly recommend them for diesel, generator or tire needs.

name: B Sisk
text: A yearly visit to Bay Diesel is a must. Excellent , experienced and knowledgeable. From Chris to the entire staff.

name: Mack White
text: Quality Service.

name: Mike Coker
text: Had M3 service done on motorhome last month. Seems to be "the" place to have ur service done while in Red Bay!

name: Pete Pizzola
text:
Very professional and friendly
Quick work,  very fair prices
Thank you

name: Gayle Snedecor
text: Expensive, but competent.

name: mfer lkk
text: Guys are great, prices fair. Thanks

name: Robyn Skipton
text: Squeezed us in for av generator service and did the service for a fair price

name: Allen Smith
text: Really great community and friendly fellow campers, fulltiming it here and its been so awesome!

name: Jordan Patterson
text: Perfect community of full timers. The owners live and operate from the grounds and are awesome people.

name: Eric Campbell
text: Very nice place. Easily seen from the highway. Very neat and clean.

name: Shawn Redondo
text:
I start by saying that we didn't spend time there and I didn't ask the price up front.

We spent the night at cathedral caverns and then the lake. On our way home we stopped by to see if there was a dump station that we could use. The lady was very nice and said that they don't have a public dump station but for a small fee we can dump our tanks up front. After dumping the tanks I ask her how much and her response was $40. I couldn't believe that I heard her right, so I asked her again...$40!!!? She responded with yes, where else are you going to dump your tanks.

I'm sorry but stay away from this place if they are going to charge an insane amount for dumping tanks. Thanks for the outstanding service!!!!

name: Edward Vance
text: The owners are amazing, the prices are reasonable and the residents are nice and quiet. The lake and water is across the street, fishing is fun and the pool is nice on a hot summer day! Chris and Penny, the owners take care of the park and know you by name. Highly recommend!

name: SunShine Werner
text: I visit our friend Ricky here often, in the past year have made life long friends and memories w/alot of HH's residents❤️ I'm a single mama & buying a camper is out of my budget right now..BUT, one day I hope to live here. Such a peaceful, awesome place!

name: Jamie Manley
text: My father has lived here for over 3 years and he loves it. Close lake access, friendly people, and the general owners are great.

name: Austin
text: Reasonable prices, great management, and a amazing location.

name: david taga
text:
Touring acoss the states from California to Indiapolis with a drum and bugle corp with a Winnebago.  It needed an oil change and I found Alabama RV Shop close by. Went there and I thought I was in the wrong place, but the address is correct.
Its a family owned business in which Glen, the owner, is very knowledgeable on RV's.
I would recommend for basic RV repairs.

name: Meagan
text: Do not take your camper here. They are dishonest people who do not make it right when they mess something up. Our camper was hit and damaged in the inside. The owner refused to make it right, telling us he did not want our business (after he was paid to fix our air conditioner). If you want your camper taken care of, DO NOT take it here!!

name: fat mama's lunchbox
text: It's a great place to get work done and the help is so great

name: Reginald Cook
text: Its a great place to get work done and the ppl are great

name: ty smith
text: Never been

name: David Crauswell
text: A great place

name: Butch Gantt
text: Great enclosed gated storage for RV and will order any part you need.

name: Florence Papa
text: We stopped here while traveling on the road. Our vent cover needed to be replaced. They were very courteous and professional when they assisted us.

name: Bevil Johnston
text: Brandon does good work if you need repairs, and its a great place to store your RV.

name: Michael Jernigan
text:
The way this establishment treated my brother and his family because he was an African American, I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone!!! The service was awful, they kept his RV over 8 months and didn’t fix anything on the RV.

My Caucasian friends recommended this place to me because of all the things they had them fix on their RV. My brother bought his RV here to have the same small issues fixed and he was told after 8 months that they don’t fix any of those things on RV’s anymore! Unbelievable...

name: Nicholas Milner
text:
To put it as professionally and simple as I can the customer service is really bad! We weren’t reinventing the wheel nor were we solving the problems in Washington.We were simply installing a new awning and the parts never arrived over a period of six weeks.
After an extended period I called and inquired with no return call, I went by and expressed my desire to know a date to expect my repair to be completed and Brandon vowed to have me answers on the following Monday. This day come and went with no communication as well. I waited until today (Thursday) to call and there were still no answers to my question.Brandon called me 3 hours later and informed me the supplier wasn’t sure if it was shipped, going to ship or might ship!
At this time I expressed my irritation and asked Brandon if this was a job he really wanted to do or did I need to find another repair shop..His words were “ I can’t seem to satisfy you so just come get it”.. so I did and I hope whom ever reads this thinks twice before letting your unit sit and sit and sit.

name: Carol P
text: Excellent deal for $40 a month. I would give this a five star rating when the rest of the gravel is put in. Ask about their separately priced setup options, too. How wonderful it is to have someone bring your camper to where you want it, and then have it set up for you when you arrive.

name: Josh King
text: Excellent and friendly service, and these are good honest business people.  Even though they aren't the closest RV place to me, I will always take my business to them since they are such a good business.

name: Jon Marshall
text: Rarely do you find exceptional customer service like you do here.  I stored my camper and 5 X 9 trailer here for a year and cannot be happier with the friendly, professional service I've received.  With a simple phone call they've gladly handled every request from packing my bearings to filling my propane tanks.  Brandon, Mark, and the rest of the team are terrific.

name: Dean Beery
text: Took the trailer in for warranty work on a refrigerator that had quit working.  They were the quickest to take us in, in the area.  Great service, went the extra mile with us.  The Norcold refrigerator had a part that was new to their line and hadn't put out a bulletin for it.  The service department helped with contact with Norcold and helped set up the delivery of the part to the next area we are traveling to and also got the refrigerator working on propane.  Spent all morning with us.  No charge to us.

name: Kevin Long
text: Very Knowledgeable staff and they do great work!!!

name: Bill Idle
text: Best service I have encountered. We were traveling and had electrical problems. They got us in imediately and on the road.  Very professional and cost effective.

name: Karen Winchell
text: Gray water drainage pipe broke...Analized the situation 2day...We stayed overnight in our motorhome...Will B fixed 2morrow...Employees very knowledgeable...professional...friendly people...Very pleased with our visit...

name: Dudley Christian
text: Best place in area for RV service and professional staff.

name: C Ray Marilu S Beasley
text: Well run family business. They will order any part needed.

name: Tammy Barganier
text: Nice employee, very helpful to my friend.

name: Elcm 1008
text: helpful staff very friendly

name: Minwoo Kim
text: Nice people to work with

name: Angie Carter
text: Excellent RV repair.

name: Rolland Lessard
text:
(Translated by Google) Reliable and understanding staff, very well located, I got myself towed here for repair on RV, problem solved. Storage available here inexpensive, large location, several RVs on site. Thanks to Billy and Bradom who took care of us. RECOMMENDED

(Original)
Personnel fiable et compréhensif ,très bien situé ,je me suis fait remorque ici pour réparation sur VR ,problème résolu.Storage disponible ici pas dispendieux,endroit vaste,plusieurs VR sur place .Merci à Billy et Bradom qui s est occupé de nous.Je RECOMMANDE

name: Rocky Redding
text: Good BLT

name: Jo Anne Curran
text: Best repairs!!!  Competent, knowledgeable.   Great, fair prices.  If I could rate it higher I would.  Malcolm definitely knows RVs!

name: Larry Jackson
text: Waited over a month, nothing happened.

name: George Gilliam
text: Great friendly staff, knowledgeable and got me in and out on a busy Saturday afternoon within an hour. Very impressed with the service

name: Jim Wilson
text: Earlier I filled out an evaluation, but I didn't have much business with them. I placed an RV with them to have the refrigerator checked due to it not working. Took them to weeks to get it fixed. The thing had blown a fuse. It was the manufacturer who said the blown was easily accessable. I personally took the  refrigerator down. No fuse where the manual and a tv rep told me it was located. So not RV Roadway problem. Joe the mechanic who worked on it actually found a fuse and replaced it, working fine now. But it sure wasn't where the manufacturer stated. So now my experience with this company has jumped from a 1 to 4.5 Treated well and politely. Recommend them. But they are busy.

name: james henry
text: The dedication of the team here is amazing they are restoring my 1953 travel trailer and are taking care of every detail highly recommended

name: Justice For All
text: They had exactly what I needed service desk was very friendly and helpful.

name: Charles Boothe
text: The parts department staff is always nice and courteous. Great people working in the parts department.

name: RC Collum
text: Super nice and helpful

name: Gary Kendrick
text: Great service

name: Jason Williams
text: Incredible staff! Extremely nice and went above and beyond to help me and my family with our car. Will recommend them to everyone.

name: MA306
text: The tow truck driver James was fantastic! He went out of his way to provide an exceptional and professional experience. I was 100% pleased with the service I received and highly recommend this company!

name: Theresa Smith
text: The driver that picked up my Dodge Charger and took it to Encore Dodge was very very nice and polite. Would recommend this towing service to anyone.

name: Norman Gabbard
text:
I got ran off road in my truck.
It happened about two miles from my house.
I hit a phone pole and got injured.
Before being transported to hospital. I requested my truck be towed to my house.
After being released my truck was not in my yard.
I found out Bay Ciy towing towed it to their lot.
I call to asked them to tow it to my house on a Friday. Although I had towing insurance,they said I had to come pay a hundred and fifty dollars first.
Here i was with no,vehicle,beat up and bruised up by wreck.
I told them I couldn't tell i could get a way. There place is about twenty miles from mine.
They agreed to wave twenty five a day that weekend and Martin Luther King day. For bank was closed that day.
Although I was upset about the long tow and fee.
I just wanted my truck.
I'm an elderly man and the truck is my livelyhood.
I go there today,Tuesday.
Payed the hundred and fifty and had the lady at front desk to talk to my insursnce agent for payment to tow truck to my place.
They both agreed. That's another seventy five dollars.
I wait all day for delivery.
I call towing company around four.
The lady said my truck is on the way.
I walk out to end of my drive and see the tow truck with my truck coming my way.
I only live a short ways down. The road is a dirt road with some low places.
But pretty solid. A little water in some.
But drivable without getting stuck. Just yesterday I seen a rollback come through easy.
The lady driver stopped about fifty yards before my drive. I kept motioning for her to come on.
She set there for like twenty minuts.
I'm standing there with a badly injured leg .
I call the office. The lady there says the driver is refusing to drive to my yard because of fear of getting stuck.
I tell the lady the holes aren't deep, its not soft. It's full of cement.
The driver still refuses.
Then she backs up into my neighbors yard. She sets there. I walked down there. The blond rolls down window and started talking 90 miles an hour. I say,hun..Please just listen. I know this road. I promise sweety,you won't get stuck.  She still refuses and acts like she's gonna leave with my truck.
Now my patients are thinning.
I'm hurting.
I call the office. The lady says the driver isn't gonna take it to my yard.
She also said they were bringing the truck back and would have to wait tell the road was better.
Thats when I lost all patents.
I told the driver,hell no your not. Drop it right here. I payed to have it delivered to my place  and you are refusing to deliver it. My place is right there.
Thats my property,I need it and your not leaving with it. The bill is payed and you are not holding up your end of the agreement  !
She says,the bill isn't payed. I said, oh hell yes it is. I was standing there when my insurance agent agreed to it ,plus the hundred and fifty I payed.
She got all cocky and rolled the window up.
I stood there waiting for my truck to be unloaded in someone else's yard. Not knowing how to get it to mine..
After about five minuts she got out running her mouth threatening to leave with it.
I dial 911. She shut up.
Then while she unloaded it,she in a smart attitude said,I bet your not gonna sign the delivery paper too.
I told,her, yes,ill sign it because unlike you I try to do what's right.
She dropped the truck. I went checking my truck waiting to sign. She got in the tow truck and left.
Now I'm hurting bad. My BP is up ,I can barley walk and don't know how ill get my truck out of these peoples yard into mine.
After about an hour of talking to people. We were able to drag it into my yard..
It is now seven o'clock and my BP is still up. I'm still hurting and mad at how wrong they done me.
I gave one star,just for them waving the storage fee. But after how they ended up doing me.they don't deserve that !
I will never agree for them to tow me again. I didn't this time. I'm just saying.
If I ever need a tow. I will say,anyone except Bay City Towing..
They screwed me 3 different ways. Got me upset,put me through pain and labor I payed them to do. No more.
I recommend everyone to avoid Bay City Towing. Just refuse it..

name: Deano Allnutt
text: I was stuck at the light car over heated ended up jumping time and a tow truck driver named james stopped and helped me get to mcdonald's. From there he helped me figure out the issue of the car and car still wouldn't start. James didn't have to stop and help us but he took the time and did it anyway and I appreciate his service thanks to him we are getting a tow home and I couldnt be happier glad it was him who stopped. Thank you bay city for hiring a good tow truck driver and thank you James for helping me and my dad out your awesome!!!!

name: Peggy Roberts
text: This company is a joke! They towed my sons car due to an accident and the tow truck driver, James, was given to much money. He was not honest and did not return the money! The old lady in the office was very rude when I went over there and was very politely explaining the situation, she kept putting her hands in my face until I told her there was no reason to be rude. She even said James told her he was given 3 fifties a twenty and a 5 which is what was gave to him for a tow that I was charged $125. Anyways these people are thieves and their employees look like dope heads. Did I mention that when James, the tow truck driver arrived at the scene his eyes was as big as a silver dollar he was so high he couldn't even talk right

name: Debra Harmon
text: Love it. It's a one stop shop for all your needs. Clean bathrooms nice and so helpful and polite staff. Great prices too.

name: Harold Lehmann
text: Went to bay city paint an body to have a partial j skirt fabricated and painted, the estimate given to me was $200-$250. Three days later was informed the part was ready, got there and the it started, the cost was now no longer as per the estimate $200-$250 but now to my surprise $881.60.after about 20 minutes of compIaining got the price down to $681.60. Will never go back again and they should not expect any positive reccomendations on my part. Never trust any estimates given to you by these people

name: Valarie Helton
text: I had to get a fan motor for my air conditioner and it was very difficult finding the right one because the parts were not updated. But they were very friendly and helpful. Thank you for your service. I am cool once again.

name: james healey
text: I called 18 places, most were "cool cat" sellers.   Ha ha.  Most said they didn't work on them.   These guys were 100% wonderful.   We are back on the road.

name: Arlene Dean
text: Highly recommended towing service.  Our driver was Matt & he treated our vehicle with care in addition to welcoming us to the city.  His kind recommendation for repair was spot on.  I am normally skeptical of tow drivers (kickbacks) and even through my being aloof and cautious, he was considerate, educated, and professional.  We are so pleased they are on the list of approved tow companies with our insurance.

name: Russell Tayler
text: Great service if you need your RV services take it here.

name: Kimmy Smith
text: I would not suggest using this service. This service was used through my road side assistance on my insurance and I did not have the initial contact with them and it was stated that I would not be with my car. Bay City was supposed to pick up my car while I was at work. I missed a few calls and returned the call to have a woman at Bay Side essentially harassing me, screaming at me and asking why I could not answer and where my car was. My insurance set up the tow, not me, and I did not deserve any sort of attitude or harassment. I could not describe the location it was towed to, because it was towed to a storage location the night before and I was not there. I am not from Mobile and have no idea any name of streets or locations as I just moved here one month ago. I knew the name of the place it was located only and I was yelled at, although my insurance company gave them the address, not me. My logic is that you should never yell at a paying customer, especially when they have not even said a single word to you before. How incredibly rude, as if my car breaking down after a move across the country wasn't stressful enough. I will make sure to tell everyone I know to avoid this place.

name: Valerie J Taylor
text: These people are simply Ahhhmazing!!! They changed our oil in our Motorhome and the Generator, did some repair on our generator (sensor, belt, etc) and worked on the mechanism for the step to the motorhome. Most important, they told us everything they were doing, as they did it. When we got there Ron and several of the guys came right out of the shop and jumped right on all the issues immediately. They hooked us up to shore power and let us stay in their parking lot overnight. ***Most importantly they simply treated us like family***. We would like to recommend them to anybody passing through the Mobile area. They also worked with our warranty company to make the process seamless. We wouldn't hesitate to come back here for anything we need.

name: Jessica Jones - murphy
text: I needed a tow had been in the heat since 1130am. They never showed up. After they say they at the house

name: Kurt Clingan
text: We broke down just west of of Grand Bay and our insurance company called Bay City Paint and Body to give us a tow. Didn't catch the driver's name, but he was great, on time and took care of my truck while loading/unloading. I'd recommend them again for towing assistance.

name: Whitney Webb
text: Would not recommend this place to absolutely anyone. Worst customer service I have ever experienced. The lady who worked at the front desk was very unprofessional. They charged us $630 to get a vehicle that was at there lot for 4 days. She told us not to worry what the charges were for and to just sign the f'ing paper. I am not an idiot and do not just sign things for the fun of it. She then pointed her finger in my mother's face and told her she was about to get an attitude if she does not sign it. (like we were scared). anyways, the cops were called and we were told to turn them over to the better business bureau because this isn't there first complaint on them. We are doing that now. Because it was suppose to only be $180 for tow plus 20$ a day. They messed with the wrong ones to think we would let this go 🙂 They also had all the personal items in the office which had missing items. (I guess they dug through our vehicle). The lady told me to exit the office and told a man to grab me and get me out (which didn't happen bc he was confronted very quick like). But, the point of the story is to not use these folks. They will rip you off. Hopefully soon they won't even be in business 🙂 The lady in the office was very mad that we had already talked to an officer who had taken there name off there towing list & also turned them over to be investigated 🙂 Don't use these people if you are smart 😅

name: Terri James
text: I had a warranty on a heatpump that was not honored.  Would not ever purchase anything from them again.

name: Hagan Williams
text: These people are criminals. Car was towed by them, charged me $300 for “administrative fees”, the ladies reasoning was that she had to do some paperwork for the car? (Assuming she makes 10$ an hour, you mean to tell me it took 30 hours of her time to fill out some paperwork???) not to mention charging me $27.50 to pay with a credit card. Ide give them 0 stars if I could.

name: S. Stephens
text: Used Bay City through my roadside assistance and they were very helpful getting my car to the dealership. They showed up exactly at the time promised by roadside.  Would definitely call them first next time I need a tow.

name: Lisa Carper
text: The best place to have any repairs done to your RV or even your vehicle!

name: bob Rog
text: Great people and quality work!

name: Richard Murphy
text: Friendly service and a knowledgeable staff

name: Evante Dotson
text: Paint ed my car fast

name: Doug Roberts
text: This is the outfit that is in the hip-pockets of the corrupt University of South Alabama police to tow unwitting students' cars, far away to another city, as they are made to pay hundreds of dollars for the unprovoked theft of property.

name: Larry Saunders
text: Okay

name: marian fischer
text: Didn't know it was that hard to get tires. I guess know the mode is find a place like above or Sam's club maybe.  Called the above yesterday,gave them car info, ordered tires, called today at 2pm to come on down for the install. In less than an hour, got all 4 installed. Very, quick friendly and efficient,  I think we found our new place for oil changes too!! Thank you, Matthew.

resp.text: Marian, we are proud to provide quality and efficient tire services for our customers! Thank you for sharing this feedback and we look forward to seeing you for an upcoming oil change!

name: Comfort Services
text: Matt has always taken good care of my personal and commercial vehicles.  They will continue to have my business.

resp.text: Thank you for trusting us to provide quality services for your personal and commercial vehicles! We look forward to working with you next time!

name: Joshua Pirtle
text: Customer service was %100. I needed a trailer tire. On the phone and in person %100. I think I was in the lobby a total of 5 minutes. Didn't even have time to sit down. Though if I had to wait their waiting room was nice and cool with plenty of room to watch the cars drive by. Total experience I will always take my tire business there from now on!

resp.text: Thank you, Joshua, we appreciate your feedback! We take pride in our friendly staff and keeping a clean environment for our guests. We look forward to working with you again!

name: Linda Martin
text: Went in to have air checked. They were very helpful and had air checked in a very timely manor. Their waiting room was clean and comfortable. I will go back when I need tires replaced.

resp.text: Linda, thank you for choosing us to inspect your vehicle's A/C. We are proud to deliver a comfortable and professional auto service experience for our customers and we look forward to seeing you when you are ready for those tires!

name: John Petit
text: To anyone in the Foley, Gulf Shores and Orange Beach area who needs engine repair, please strongly consider Fausak.  I gave them 5 stars and took the time to write a review and here is why.  They performed the service review on my 2015 Toyota Avalon with 70K miles and it was missing badly and seemed like a coil pack problem.  The original diagnosis and estimate came in around $650.  I gave them the verbal to proceed and they called back an hour and half later to tell me that their original diagnosis was incorrect and that they found the problem.  A beach mouse/rodent chewed the fuel line to one of the cylinders and the bill would be $136 parts and labor.  I was overjoyed and consider that an incredible testimony to their honesty and integrity.  I will do business with them whenever I can in the future and I recommend them highly.

resp.text: John, we appreciate you sharing your experience. It is important to our business to treat our customers with respect and honesty when it comes to their auto repair needs. Thank you for coming to us with your Toyota Avalon and we look forward to working with you next time!

name: Mike Cents
text: Matt from Fausak is our go-to guy. His team of mechanics is amazing. Matt consistently has a great attitude and always tries to help no matter the issue at hand. Do yourself a favor and acquaint yourself with Fausak.

resp.text: Mike, we are proud to have a staff that delivers high quality repairs and experiences for our customers. Thank you for leaving us this feedback and we look forward to seeing you again!

name: Tony Chapman
text: Stopped by without an appointment due to a tire on my travel trailer losing air. We were greeted and immediately taken into a bay for service, the technician quickly discovered the problem and the tire was repaired and mounted. Very professional service writers and technicians ×ith a new and modern facility. We were back on the road to continue our vacation all within an hour.  Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us, Tony. It was our pleasure to quickly diagnose the issue with your trailer tire and get you back on your vacation in no time!

name: Joan Harris
text: My son got a nail in his tire, and it went flat on the interstate in Mississippi.  When he changed his tire to the spare, he broke the stud that holds the lug nut on.  With some calling and stress, I got him to our vacation spot in Orange beach.  I called Fausak and talked to Raymond (who was very kind). They were so accommodating, fixed his tire, and even found another nail in another tire and fixed it.  They did it quick and we were back to our vacation within an hour.  I highly recommend this place.

resp.text: It was our pleasure to take care of the punctured tires on your son's vehicle and get your family back to your vacation! We appreciate you sharing this experience and if there are any auto repair or tire services we can assist with in the future, just let us know!

name: Donna Jo Mcbride
text: I really appreciate the people who work there, they are pleasant and give me information on what's going on with my vehicle, I will be going back im glad they're there

resp.text: We appreciate you trusting our team to perform quality auto services, Donna! Thank you for sharing this feedback and we look forward to working with you next time!

name: Bill Scott
text: Fast service and great price.  Give them a chance to  earn your business.

resp.text: We appreciate your business and your feedback, Bill! Thank you for trusting us with your vehicle's service needs!

name: Stacey Staimpel
text: I had a very pleasant experience with this company. The customer service was by far the best I have received in many years. Very friendly and helpful staff , all the way around! All at a great price, to boot! Will definitely be returning! Thanks guys.

resp.text: It was our pleasure to provide you with a quality auto repair experience, Stacey! Combining great repairs and great customer service is what we strive for with each customer! Thank you for the kind review and we look forward to seeing you next time!

name: Doug Bounds
text: Bought a set of tires and had them mounted on wheels to install on a project later. They had to order the tires, but they came in as promised and the job was completed on-time, as priced. If you need more from a tire store than what Fausak delivers, you're going to be looking for a long time.

resp.text: We appreciate you coming to Fausak Tires & Service for your tire needs, Doug! It was our pleasure to order and mount the tires onto your wheels for your future project. If there is any service you need completed in the future, don't hesitate to reach out!

name: Susan Ballard
text: Truck runs good. Too...expensive for parts and labor for two hours work.

resp.text:
Susan,

We are sorry that you didn’t find our prices appealing. We strive to be price competitive in the industry while continuing to provide high quality products and employ a well-trained staff with years of experience to get the job done quickly and correctly! We hope for the opportunity to provide you with quality auto service again in the future. Thank you.

name: Randy Englebert
text: They have good products along with great service. They don't over charge they fix

resp.text: Thank you for sharing this great feedback, Randy! It is important to us to provide our customers with the best service and the best products to keep them on the road as long as possible!

name: Brian Cunningham
text: Awesome crew and great pricing... Highly recommended..

resp.text: Thank you for the review and recommendation, Brian! We are proud to have a great staff here that provides quality auto repair experiences for our customers!

name: Regina Marshall
text: I had my tires rotated and balanced I went on a Wednesday morning had no wait. Very friendly and professional, I will go back if the need arises.

resp.text: We are pleased to hear you had a positive experience during your tire rotation and balance, Regina! We look forward to helping with any automotive service needs you may have in the future!

name: Kelly Crawford

name: M. Tyler Arthur
text: Stopped in to check a deflated tire and was told a ( perfectly fine otherwise) tire cannot be repaired/plugged more than once. Upon a quick search - this isn't the case at all! Fausak will not see my cars again. Honesty and trust are most important to me and was let down on both fronts.

resp.text: Mr. Arthur,  Thank you for reaching out to us and pointing out our miscommunication.  Your tire had a puncture that was too close to a prior repair and together the repairs would have overlapped.  This makes the tire unsafe to repair according to the Tire Industry Association and the US Tire Manufacturers Association.  Our top priority is the safety of all our guests and employees, and ultimately every other car on the road.  We failed to explain these guidelines accurately which led to the misunderstanding and for that we apologize.  We have sent a copy of the excerpts from each of these guidelines to you.   If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to reviews@fausaktire.com or call the Foley store.  Thank you.

name: Harvel Scales
text:
4/17/20
My name is Harvel Scales and this message is about my visit to Bankston RV this morning at the Florence location. I've never done business with Bankston but what happened today was more than just business, it was extraordinary service!
Joe Gervais, Parts & Service Dept , had never met me until this visit. I thought I needed to buy, for the second time a new thermal couple. I was totally frustrated because I couldn't get the 6 gallon water heater working for my vintage Airstream restoration project. This was after tinkering with the thing for two days and watching about four hours of YouTube video.
With out my asking, Joe volunteered to put my 47 year old water heater on his work bench for a complete check out and test. It only took a few minutes for him to discover what I had completely overlooked; a faulty propane regulator!
Selling a thermocouple would have been the quick and simple thing to do for a customer who was interrupting the work flow for an item selling for no more than a few bucks.
At Bankston today I received a courtesy that I think is rare and over the top, all for "no charge".
You can bet that my friends in the camping world will hear this story.
Thanks Joe!
Harvel Scales

text:
A 2nd chance for this company was purely a waste. I brought my travel trailer to them for a possible trade. The sales man looked at it, then sent paperwork to the Nashville office to be appraised; new rules he said. Not sure how someone 2 hours away can properly appraise a trailer, but I went with it.

My trailer is listed on the internet in a thousand places, but because the "sales mgr" couldn't find it in his little book, he refused to give me a price for it. It's made by Forrest River, you know those folks... The biggest RV manufacturer in the world! The sales person said he would call me in a few minutes, because he would get it worked out. 24 hours later... Not a peep.

Aside from the blaring heavy metal music coming from the shop, the sales staff is clueless. This is my 2nd attempt to work with these folks. They lost my business the first time based on stock and pricing. There will not be a 3rd attempt. I didn't understand how they stayed in business, until I saw their $110 labor rate posted on the door....

name: Frank Smith
text: I made a phone call to Bankston Motor Homes on Florence Blvd last week to inquire a quote to fill my propane tank. I was told 89 cents a lbs and that I should have a 20 or 30 lbs tank on my RV. I should have known better than to choose Bankston at this time since the manager on the phone acted like it was such a hassle to give me the total price for both tanks. (After all the trouble he went through for the total.) I was told it was 19.28 for a 20lbs tank and 28.32 for a 30lbs tank. Which sounds reasonable, so I didn't bother to check anywhere else in town. When I arrived today, I was greeted by a professionally dressed man asking if I needed any help. I responded I need to get my propane tank filled and to get my brakes checked. I then pulled around to get my tank filled and was told it would be next week before they could get to my brakes. No big deal I thought. so I go inside to pay and the total came to 53 and some change. I confronted him about the quote I was gave over the phone and he immediately got defensive and started to explain why I was being charged more. Since I was interested in doing more business with them with my brake problem, you would assume that he would do what was necessary to make things right. He might have took a small loss on the propane but would have simply made it up in the outstanding labor charges. When you quote someone a price you stick with that price to make your customer feel valued. I really felt like I was nothing but in the way and a hassle to them as soon as I pulled onto the lot. Bankston Motor homes is less than a mile from my house. However I will make the drive to Coldwater RV center in Muscle shoals for any future service or maintenance I need for my RV. name: CJ Branton
text:
The level of customer service found at this location is rare!  I live in Nashville TN and my search for an RV took me to Bankston Motor Homes of Warrior, Alabama!  While there is a Bankston Motor Homes in Nashville I'm thankful to have met and did business with the great folks in Warrior.  I'd make that journey 1,000 times over!  Daryl, Janet, Johnny, and Paul are the most caring, thoughtful, and thorough people I have encountered in a long time, even well after the sell!  This was my very first RV purchase and Johnny spent hours with me going over every detail of my new RV.  Johnny made recommendations on proper maintenance and intervals in order to enjoy my purchase for years to come.  Johnny and Paul made sure all systems on my RV were operational and performing optimally.

Unfortunately, when I got my RV hooked up and went to pull off the lot I had some mechanical issues on my truck.  Johnny was there to help me get turned around and back on the lot.  Being late in the evening and after closing they allowed me to set up my RV on the lot and spend the night until I could get a tow truck the next morning and find a rental truck to pull my RV home.  Johnny was very helpful during the whole ordeal.  They made sure I had the necessities I needed to get through the night.  The next morning Johnny came to me and offered to take me to get breakfast if I wanted.  Daryl personally stopped what he was doing to give me a ride to pick up my rental truck.

The entire experience at Bankston Motor Homes of Warrior was top notch!  I left feeling like family.  I left the lot to go spend the weekend camping to break in my new RV.  Johnny called me Sunday evening to check on me and make sure I made it home safe and that I didn't have any issues with my RV.

I cannot say thank you enough, nor say enough good things about these folks!  Daryl, Janet, Johnny and Paul I am truly thankful for a great experience!  Y'all are the best folks!

text:
Terrible customer service.  I tried to buy from this dealership, had my financing in order, drove two hours to the dealership.  They would not take the time to complete the paper work that day, would not let me take the unit with me, told me I was required to take a four hour class.
I understand for new owners needing to take this course.  I live in a RV full time to travel for work.  I am very familiar with the maintenance and  operation of a RV.  I even accepted they wanted to keep the RV for a few days to make sure everything worked properly.  They still would not sit down and complete the paperwork with me but wanted me to give them a down payment.
FYI then person who walks into your dealership is your CUSTOMER.  You are not doing them a favor to sell them a RV. When I asked about ordering a different RV,  which was the RV I really wanted they said oh it will take 6 weeks.  in fact they had two coming within the following two weeks.  They would not even discuss with me ordering one for me.

BUT I went to BAMA RV in Dothan Al.  They had me a unit ordered the day I called them it took a week and half to have the RV ready for me!!!!

resp.text:
Here at Paradise RV Sales in Warrior, Al. we strive to satisfy each and every customer to the best of our ability. We have set in place a very strict set of Company Policies that we follow to ensure each and every customer receives a camper that has been  thru our Service Department for a complete pre delivery inspection which consist of more than 75 items, including appliance checks, plumbing checks, electrical checks, sealant checks, proper slide out operations, installing a 12 volt battery and many more in depth inspections. This takes the better part of the day but insures that the customer can leave with confidence that everything is in working order. ( the prospective buyer  does not have the option to waive the inspection, it is required by the Manufacturer and Paradise RV Sales) We also like to walk thru the camper with the customer  after the pre delivery inspection to make sure the customer is satisfied before departing with their new camper.  ( this ensures that the customer has no surprises when they get home) As with any business we ask for earnest money to engage into a transaction and start the process, taking the camper off the market for sale, doing a pre delivery inspection and ordering Loan Contracts from a Bank. If  a prospective buyer refuses to sign an agreement to purchase with a minimum deposit for earnest money then we cannot move forward with a purchase.As a Company whose goal is Customer Satisfaction we Reserve The Right Not To Sale to any Prospective Buyer that Refuse to abide by our Company Policies.
So to all of our Customers and Non Customers Paradise RV Sales would like to take this opportunity to wish  you good luck in all of your camping adventures.

text: Like another reviewer, I asked if I could get my camper without the customer tutorial. Daryl and Janet did not want to sell us the camper without the customer walk through. I wanted to skip the walk through. They insisted if we were going to buy, the walk through was required. I must admit that at first I was perplexed as to why they would not just sell me a camper and take my money. They really wanted us to have a good experience with their product and had our best interest in mind when they basically refused to sell without me or my wife going through the tutorial. Now I can honestly say I'm glad that we purchased from Paradise RV. My new trailer brakes that were installed the day before failed to work. I live 2 hours away from Paradise RV but luckily Johnny, in the service department, crawled under my truck. He had the problem fixed in 15 minutes. We have had our Coachmen Clipper 17bh for 3 months now and love it.

I am Daryl Lowe, my wife Janet and I are the Owners here at Paradise RV Sales. We would like to take this opportunity to apologize to our real customers, it appears we are the target of Internet Spamming. In the past 30 days we have received several low ratings and slanderous remarks about our business. After a full review of our customer data base we have not been able to locate any customers named David Kerrie or Sophie Grace which David referenced in this review. If we have no records of these people evidently we have not done business with them. Therefore, the reviews are either meant for another Dealership or this could be a competitor trying to lower our Google ratings. David Kerry we would like to personally invite you to our Dealership to sit down with us, so that we may see what your concerns are. We look forward to meeting with you. We have been in business for over 20 years because we care about our customers and we want you to know we are here and available for you.
Anyone reading this review that is considering doing business with us, we ask that you take a moment to read all of our Google Reviews, check out our website www.paradiservsales.net customer testimonies page, pick up the phone and call us direct (205) 631-6006 we will more than happy to talk with you and answer any questions, if you prefer email my email address is daryl@paradiservsales.net. If you would like to come out and visit with us we will be glad to spend time with you, introduce you to our team, the Sales Dept. Jarad and Ed, the Parts Dept. Manager Barry Ugolini and our Service Manager Johnny Wideman. Janet and I are very proud of our Team and the Loyal Customer base that we have established over the past 20 years. In the Retail Business we may not be able to make everyone we come in contact with happy, but we will always be willing to sit down with anyone and try to work it out. Daryl and Janet Lowe the Proud Owners of Paradise RV Sales Warrior, Alabama.

text: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!  OWNER LIES!!!  TOOK OUR DEPOSIT AND SAID REFUNDABLE!!!  BRAND NEW RV DELIVERED HAD DAMAGES ALL OVER IT.  OWNER IS VERY ARROGANT AND HAS TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.

resp.text: Ms. Grace, after a full review of our Customer’s Data Base which includes the Sales Department, Parts Department and Service Department we can find no record of you ever being a customer at Paradise RV Sales. We have researched all sales orders, canceled sales orders, each salesman’s potential customer log, phone call logs, email logs, fax logs, credit applications, cash deposits and credit card deposits. We simply cannot locate your name or any of your information in our files. With that being said we believe you have mistakenly reviewed the wrong Business and would respectively ask that you please review your information and consider correcting the review. After you have had the opportunity to review your information and you are still unhappy with Paradise RV Sales, I would like to personally invite you to our Dealership to sit down with me, so that I may see what your concerns are. My name is Daryl Lowe I am the owner here at Paradise RV Sales and I look forward to meeting with you.We have been in business for over 20 years because we care about our customers and I want you to know I am here and available for you.

name: Ronnie Taylor
text: Great selection

resp.text: Ronnie we appreciate you taking the time to sit down and write a 5 Star review. Daryl & Janet Lowe.

Daryl and Janet Lowe

Charlie

Daryl and Janet Lowe

name: Stan Bylinowski
text: We had a very good experience at Campers Inn in Madison Alabama. Everyone was very nice and accommodating without the usual high pressure sales techniques. They gave us a great deal on our new Open Range fifth wheel and top dollar for our trade.

name: Trenton
text: Very friendly staff with lots of knowledge and experience. Good people that were very willing to let us shop and ask questions at our own pace. Highly recommend that you stop and check out their inventory!

name: Deb Kaiser
text: Our experience was great with this business. People were great to work with. We were able to inspect the units we were interested in and when we needed a representative to help with questions, the person was knowledgeable and professional.

name: Kirk Monroe
text:
Greeted immediately and introduced to someone to assist and address our questions (Clay in the sales dept). Did a great job finding out our interest and what would be important for our investment. Clay went past the sales process into a customer service focus and acted as a valued consultant. Quite pleased with the experience.
Paperwork and delivery process were streamlined and went smoothly.
Would recommend to friends and family to shop here.

name: Daddyroot Daddyroot
text: Very helpful. I had improper straps and they were kind enough to help me secure my propane tank for refilling insted of just letting me wing it. Good price. Good service. What else can I say!

name: Brandon Adams
text: Everyone was very helpful. From Robert is sales, Chuck in the parts department, Aaron in the shop to Clay in Finance! You all made this a excellent experience!!! Thank you all

name: Neil Young
text: The staff is super helpful and friendly but not pushy at all which is very comforting.  The prices are definitely enticing and really good from a lot of similar places. I do recommend them for you RV needs and will definitely be going back.

name: Allison Wingfield
text:
We have had many interactions with the service dept at Madison RV. Clearly, the company's focus is NOT in the service department. We had our camper there for the better part of a YEAR, only to find... (1) We could not even see the work they did or did not do until we paid in full. (2) The work they did was SHODDY. After all that time, they left a 6"x2" hole under our shower faucet. A HOLE in the shower! They didn't even do the work on the sway bar/tow area, stating, "Uh, I didn't know what to do, so I didn't do anything." But, of course we had to pay for whatever labor cost they assigned to the undone work. (3) After getting our camper back (a few months into the year they had the camper) we discovered 2 new things had broken while at their facility (kitchen pin lights and kitchen ceiling fan) and of course we were responsible for the repair.
Were they capable to do of the repairs? Yes, I really think so. But I have to conclude that they have no motivation to complete the repairs in a timely manner, no pride in their work, poor communication between customer service and the technicians... Too many complaints and too long of a story to tell.
BOTTOM LINE: I will never return to Madison RV for work to be done on our RV.

name: Brad Mason
text: Bought a new toy hauler from Clay Phillips he is a salesman and just that nothing else once you purchase from him .He sold how great thier customer service was how great the service department was .I have yet to experience anything but disappointment. Trying to get service is like pulling hens teeth. There isn't any after the sale service. All they want is the cash after that you are forgotten. They installed a washer and dryer. I think the dryer made a week or two when it broke they said just add it to the list of everything else that's wrong. Refrigerator went out this weekend no support from Clay all I got out of service was asking what kind of a refrigerator. The list goes on and on. Sad I can't even say I got what I paid for. If you a sorry salesman and service that isn't there this is your place. B Mason

name: Tanner Wilkerson
text: Upon arrival we looked around on our own and were not rushed by salespeople as you would be on a car lot.  Eventually we asked some questions and met with Frank in sales.  We were unsure of new or used and have never owned one before.  Frank spent lots of time with us and helped walk us through the decision between new and used and gave us good practical advice which led us to look at used.  They had a good selection and we found a Camper that jumped out at us and was at a good price.  At no time did we feel pushed, pressured, or rushed and we did decide to buy that day.  The reason we bought is we liked the camper we found, Frank was very generous with the deal, the entire staff were very well informed.  I have been in sales and I was absolutely impressed with Madison RVs and the people.  They have earned my business and my referrals for life.  Upon delivery the service staff spent a generous amount of time ensuring I understood how to operate everything and Frank hung out as well to make sure we were all set.  I know that if I have any questions I can call Frank who will always be willing to help.

name: gracey bear
text: Do you consider yourself better than everyone else?  Do you enjoy being talked down to by salespeople even though they can't answer basic questions?  Do you want salespeople telling you what you want?  If so, this may be just the place for you.

name: Samuel Bennett
text: Our first time looking at RVs, it was a friendly no pressure environment.  Very helpful staff without being pressured.  Good first experience and we will definitely go back as our journey into buying an RV advances.

name: Eric Twitchell
text: There was a bit of a communication issue about ordering parts and then notification when the parts arrived.  Once everything was on site, the work was done well and fast.

name: Jackie Chris
text: Service is always great. They friendly,fast,and helpful.

name: Stephanie Horton
text: Great experience on purchasing our first new camper

name: Mary Hadden
text: Was nice looked at a camper nice people. Nice neat businesd

text: Parts service was extremely helpful and friendly. He helped make a bad day better.

name: Dee Walter
text:
We had an electrical problem and they found and fixed it within a few hours. We would have had a fire if they hadn't taken us in at the last minute on a Friday morning.  The service was above excellent and they kept us advised along the way on what was happening.

We'd recommend them to anyone.

name: Randy Barefoot
text: Excellent sales service. Matched the price of a competitor 3 hours away. Almost a year later, when we experienced an electrical problem, repairs were done quickly under warranty. They even replaced the door lock, which wasn't really a warranty issue, no charge.

name: Richard Werner
text: People were extremely friendly and accommodating! Didn’t feel like a number, they treated us like family!

name: chuck neel
text: This is the place to buy your next rv,  super nice people especially John in service he is amazingly knowledgeable and most helpful.

name: Rebecca Turner
text: Customers service  is very poor and work on RV has gotten worse. It has went down and prices gone up and workmanship is bad.

name: Ron B
text: Not very helpful in parts dept. This is my second visit, same experience. Completely ignored when I went in, then left totally alone in the store, then when employee reappeared, I was ignored again and he got on his cell phone instead of even acknowledging me.

name: Phil Smith
text: We spent an hour in this show room and not one staff member said hello or can I help you. We had the money to pay cash for anything we wanted. We noticed that other shoppers received help and a courteous greeting, the only difference I could see  was the color of our skin. I will be spending my green money else where.

name: Mrs C
text:
Knowledgeable, friendly staff
Highly recommend
Ask for Donny

name: Micheal Pepper
text: Great selection. Very large service center. No pressure. Great sales people.

name: Laurinda Whitt
text: I found the sales person to be kinda pushy. It would have been nice to look around at all they had to offer rather than just the first unit we came to based on what we might or might not be looking for.

name: John Foll
text: Great store and good service for those needing RV Parts. Looks like they have good selection of RV's too.

name: Terry Butler
text: Outstanding Service and Sales.  Tom Walker did an outstanding job........we had looked at the RVs they had and although they are very nice, just was not quite what we were looking for, so we told Tom what we were looking for..........about a month and a half later he texted me and said they had a used fifth wheel come in on trade that was impeccable and what he believed we were looking for.  I asked how much and it was reasonable...........but when I heard it was 10 years old I was skeptical..............Tom assured me it was in immaculate condition and said he would text pics which he did.  After seeing the pics we decided to go look at it in person, still thinking that it would not be as nice as he said...........well we were wrong it was everything thing we were looking for and more...........it looked as though it had never been used, we could not believe it.  So we said sold but what price could they do and include installing the rails for the fiver hitch.........again we were blown away with the price they gave us and told us that they always put the units in their large repair bays and go through all the diagnostics and fix everything that is wrong to include doing an orientation of the RV while in the bay and hooked up to show you exactly how everything works............a very thorough orientation.....although since we had had an rv before ours was much shorter than the four hours they allotted time for.  Again super service, friendly people, and a great salesman.  I recommend talking to Tom Walker if you are looking for an RV, he is outstanding and down to earth, could not have had a better experience!

name: Carl Esch
text: Great place for parts you might for your RV's heck if you do not have on they can fix you right up.

name: Greg Lee
text: Had a problem with the brakes on the trailer. Pulled in and they had someone come out and tested everything. Within minutes they pinpointed a bad wire between brake box and rear tires. They couldn't fix it today, but instructed me on how to. I am smart enough to do it myself, so we went on to our campground which was only 30 miles away. They said if I couldn't fix it, to just call and set up an appt so it will be done right. Would recommend them to anyone.

name: Chris Stantis
text: Be sure to check out their RV accessories, especially the cool kitchen ware!

name: Johnny Souder
text:
I live in Madison, Alabama, about two miles from Madison RV's business location.  I have been in Madison for 32 years and Before Madison RV was even built.  I own a motor coach and have tried several times to get parts and service from them.  They are EXTREMELY slow to "come through" and their prices for parts is EXTREMELY high compared to Bankston and online retailers of RV parts and expendables.  Example:  I just bought a filter from Bankston that cost $19.00 plus tax.  The same filter at Madison RV was marked up at $42.00... OUTRAGIOUS!!
I wanted to schedule an oil change and filter and was told I could get "on the calendar", but when I came up to the date it would be ONE TO TWO WEEKS TO GET ME IN after I was scheduled.  This has always been their story for the last 3 to 4 years every time I call and try to be a customer.  I was told about Southland International Trucks, just a few more miles down the road just off of I-565.  I went there and they scheduled me for ANY day I wanted this week!! They have a very professional shop and service bay compared to Madison RV supercenter.  I will no longer even TRY to do business with Madison RV.  Every time I called I always get a message that no one is at the counter or that they are at lunch.  I'm done.  When will they learn that customer SERVICE IS EVERYTHING!!

name: Ricky Miller
text: No problems good people ok prices

name: S. Mason Hamilton
text: If you are interested in service, this dealer is very unlikely to be of any use to you.  We have a motorhome for which Madison RV is the participating dealer, both for factory and extended warranty.  I called to ask for an appointment for service and was told that "if you didn't buy it here, it will be at least 3 months before we can look at it".  We bought it in a different state from a dealer in their network.  I have never had anyone who claimed to have an RV service department say anything like this to us.  If I owned this business I would be horribly embarrassed to give this kind of response to a potential customer.

name: John Wood
text: We went to Maison RV looking for some advice on used vs new motorhomes.  The sales, and service staff, were excellent and answered all of our questions and concerns.  We ended up getting a used motorhome from them, new to us, because it was the right choice for us and the team at Madison RV made sure we were happy.  As a new RV owner we've had some questions and the team was very willing answer all our questions, even after we left and with us coming back.  They quickly, to our satisfaction, addressed a warranty issue.  I will continue to shop, and service our motorhome, at Madison RV.  I highly recommend Madison RV anyone looking for an RV!

name: Stephen Armstrong
text: I just got home from Madison RV Super Center with our new Winnebago 2101 FBS travel trailer.  Clay Phillips was exceptional in helping us find the right small travel trailer at a super price.  I really stopped there as an after thought expecting high pressure sales at a huge RV dealer but nothing could be less true.  We never felt rushed and with Clay's help found the perfect 21 foot Winnebago we could pull with our SUV.  I bought a little Travel Trailer and was treated as if I were buying a 250K motorhome.  They also have a fantastic RV accessory store with everything you could need.  The icing on the cake was the service center getting our SUV set up with brake control and load leveling hitch.  Professional installation and they took a great deal of time going through the operation of all aspects of the trailer, the hitch and electric brakes.  I do not hand out kudos unless I really am impressed, they were great!

text: Our truck had issues that left our travel trailer stranded along side the road.  Carl stopped to see if he could help.  Which he certainly did! When I thanked him he said "“I’m not going to leave people stranded on the roadside if I can help”. Helpful is an understatement!  I am confident his work will be excellent as well, he is coming back to replace our electric post jack, which died on the same day as the truck issues!

name: April Gibson
text: To say that this place is honest, experienced and knowledgeable is an understatement!!! On Dec 26th at 5:30pm As we were pulling onto the on-ramp, we looked back to see smoke pouring from the back axle of our Forest River 5th wheel, barely averting an Rv fire. I googled mobile rv repair and this was the first number that popped up. I called and immediately got an answer and was told someone would there in about 30 min. 25 minutes later Carl pulled up in his truck with a parts trailer pulling behind. Our bearing went out. Basically it caught on fire and welded itself to the axel.  There was no way to get it off. He took off the tire and limped it to the next exit where his shop was. Thankfully he had 2 used axles. He let us stay in his lot and hooked us up with electric and water. With 2 little kids in tow, this was a huge blessing. The next morning they got to work and in 6 hours the “new” axles were installed. What we were charged was nothing what I thought it was. I’m confident that a dealer would have charged us 4x what we had to pay. Carl and Wendy, his wife, were AMAZING! If we lived close, he would be my repair guy for our rig. I more than recommend!!!

resp.text: We are glad we could fix you as quickly as we could but we would not of minded you being on the lot for a few days

I am very satisfied with the service that I have received. My truck runs like a scalded dog again. Like it did when it was new.

I appreciate being treated like a valuable customer and I highly recommend them! Thanks Andrew!

name: Julie Ryan
text:
We've had an issue with our batteries for a while, then after getting to Pt Mallard we needed to swap sites but couldn't get one slide in. They came out and checked the battery and ended up finding a somewhat hidden breaker that had flipped, keeping our batteries from charging on shore power. Harold was awesome and explained everything he did making sure that we knew what yo do should we have this issue again.

We called back the next day and had them put us on the schedule to get our slide seals checked out. We knew there were a couple that need replaced and wanted to get them all looked at. Andy came out and took a look and confirmed the ones we knew needed replaced and said that the others looked just fine. He could have easily lied and said we needed more than we did, but he's more interested in service than making a quick buck.

While here he also took a look at our thermostat for us as we've had an issue with the fan running constantly when we are on furnace, he showed us how to adjust it to auto mode (something we actually didn't think it even had) and said he'd come back out when it's warmer to re-evaluate our A/C unit (which he had issues with last summer).

We love that Andy's is all about helping you learn your RV and teaching you what you need to know rather than just showing up and doing a job and getting out.

name: Jerry
text:
Have called this business twice, both times the person who I talked with was rude and could not provide any info as to when, or if, Andy could show up to do a repair. The second call was the last straw, I made a simple request for service and was told that they didn't know if, or when, Andy could show up. I asked why, and was told that I was a problem that they didn't need to deal with. Then and she promptly hung up on me?

This is NOT how to build a successful business, and is not an asset to the community. I will not pay for arrogant and/or ignorant people to service anything. Will not call again for any reason! Recommend another business for your RV needs as this one has a checkered history of failing to complete simple tasks and charging top dollar to to little or nothing. There are several great RV repair facilities nearby, like Johnson RV. If you value your investment, then trust it to skilled pros, not amateur handymen like Andy.....

resp.text: We are so happy we were able to get your air conditioner fixed up. We know it is fixing to get hot in Alabama and definitely want you to stay cool. If there is any way we can help out, give us a call. Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.

resp.text: We are truly sorry that  the services did not meet your expectations. We wish you would have let us know you were not satisfied, so we would have had the opportunity to make sure you were happy. We do the very best that we can to go above and beyond to take care of every customer that comes through our door. We could get your interior lights to come on, but the way the interior components are straight wired to the battery and not to a fuse or power distribution panel creates a fire hazard. You and your family’s safety is the most important thing to us. That is why we recommended an airstream dealer. There was much more involved than replacing a couple lights for your exterior lights to work safely. We hope to have the opportunity to turn your experience around.

text: This couple is great!!  Caring, knowledgable and very, very helpful.  When I called, I was told to meet at their facility in order to check the problem out even though he told me right on the telephone that he had work out for 2 weeks - got me in in 3 days.  Looked at the problem, made several suggestions, we reached an agreement, he ordered the parts and got them in when he said he would and we got back together immediately instead of having me wait several days to come in.  That is quality customer service.  The repair he did on my black water system is wonderful, holding well and seems to be going to last.  I think spoke to Mrs. about possibly redoing some things on the inside.  OMG - it is obvious that she loves rennovating RV's and knows her stuff.  Things that I wanted done, she either said yes to or immediately told me what type of problems we might end up with.  I found this a great place to take an RV and they will have me back, we will continue to go back!!
